title: Frederick Forsyth interview: ‘Russian aggression hasn't stopped – we have to defend ourselves'
text:
To mark 50 years since the publication of his first book, The Biafra Story, author and former journalist Frederick Forsyth talks about reporting on the Biafran War, tricking secret police in East Germany, and the 20 years he spent going on missions for MI6

He is known for writing best-selling thrillers such as The Day of the Jackal, The Odessa File and The Fox. Yet, at the age of 81, it seems that Frederick Forsyth’s most thrilling tale is that of his own life.

“Don’t over-glamourise it,” Forsyth warns me. That, however, is easier said than done after he tells me about the years 1969 to 1992, in which he travelled the globe to carry out tasks for MI6. In his role as an “errand-runner” he met...
